titleStmt.title: A rich cabinet, with variety of inventions; unlock'd and opened, for the recreation of ingenious spirits at their vacant houres Being receits and conceits of severall natures, and fit for those who are lovers of naturall and artificiall conclusions. Whereunto is added variety of recreative fire-works, both for land, aire, and water. Also fire works of service, for sea and shore, very fitting for these warlike times of action. Collected by J.W. a lover of artificiall conclusions.
titleStmt.author: White, John, d. 1671.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for William Gilbertson at the signe of the Bible without Newgate in Giltspur-street,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
